:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="45%"}



Viviana Luccioli is a current first-year student in Georgetown University's M.S. in Data Science and Analytics program. She graduated from the University of Virginia in 2024 with a double major degree in Applied Statistics with a concentration in Biostatistics (B.A.) and Global Public Health (B.A.). In the summer of 2025, she will be interning as a Statistician and Data Analyst in the Federal Reserve Board's Information and Technology Department in Washington, D.C. Viviana's previous experiences have have included interning as a Data Manager and Engineer for a local nonprofit fighting generational poverty in Charlottesville, Virginia, and interning as a research assistant for a professor's contract in developing the international guidelines on controlled medicine policy for the World Health Organization. She also has experience as an assistant in a Swedish research team investigating trafficking in human beings for the purpose of organ removal. At Georgetown University, Viviana is acitvely involved in her graduate program, working part time as a research assistant in Dr. Qiwei He's AI Measurement and Development lab, where she is contributing her analytical skills to technical research review on the development of VR technology for educational assistance as well as performing quantitative analysis on educational behavioral data; as a student academic assistant in the Professional Development Center, where she meets one on one to mentor students through resumes, cover letter writing, and interview preparation for data science roles; and as a teaching assistant for DSAN 6150: Biological and Biomedical Data Science.
